title.narrative: ACCESS PRESCHOOL, FORMAL/ NON-FORMAL SCHOOLS

description.narrative: By 2019, more children, girls and boys, aged 3-15 years are provided with preschool, formal and non-formal schools, meeting their needs., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Early Childhood Development, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022,children aged 3-15 years, girls and boys, are in a supportive environment and benefit from inclusive quality education that integrates local distinctiveness

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2019, more children, girls and boys, aged 3-15 years are provided with preschool, formal and non-formal schools, meeting theirneeds.

description.narrative: Pour assurer la continuité des apprentissages pendant la fermeture des écoles à la suite de l’apparition de la COVID-19, des enseignements à distance par radios/TV/internet ont été organisés et des supports-papiers des cours distribués. Des campagnes de sensibilisation ont été menées et des kits d’hygiène et de protection sanitaire distribués dans toutes les 14373 écoles pour une réouverture et une rentrée scolaire sécurisée au bénéfice de 2,812,752 élèves. La mise en œuvre des mesures de protection sociale en faveur des plus vulnérables et divers appuis aux communautés rurales ont été poursuivis pour améliorer l’accès et le maintien à l’école. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:19/01/2021
